Lack of evidence: The expert found no evidence to support the claim that Donald Trump made the statement about being an atheist on The Phil Donahue Show in 1989. They also found no evidence of Trump appearing on the show in that year.
Inaccurate photo: The photo accompanying the claim was not taken during an episode of The Phil Donahue Show but during an appearance on the Oprah Winfrey show in 1988. This suggests that the photo was misleading and not directly related to the claim.
Fake quote: The expert identified the claim as one of the many fake quotes falsely attributed to Donald Trump. This highlights the prevalence of false information circulating about the presidential candidate and raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Lack of credibility: The expert's verdict includes a note about the author, Dan Evon, being a former writer for Snopes. While this aspect may not directly verify the authenticity of the claim, it provides information about the expertise and credibility of the source evaluating the claim.
